turn.1: What happened in the Battle of the Pyrenees?
turn.2: Leaving Hill in charge at Elizondo, he then rode toward Pamplona on 27 July to find out what was happening.
turn.4: He ordered Pack's 6th Division to join Cole and Picton.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: On 27 July, Wellington joined the 17,000 British and Portuguese force at Sorauren.
turn.8: To Clausel's intense frustration, Soult decided to wait for Reille's tardy corps to arrive and even took a nap.
turn.10: The next day, the Battle of Sorauren was fought when Soult's 36,000 men tried unsuccessfully to defeat the 24,000 allied forces in front of Pamplona.
turn.11: What else happened in the battle?
turn.12: The Allies lost 2,652 casualties while French losses were probably heavier.
